alert.note: Alert for Winston (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 7:46AM CDT until July 13 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Winston County in east central Mississippi... * Until 1045 AM CDT. * At 746 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Louisville, Noxapater, Millcreek, Betheden and Mcmillan. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
